title: Justice Party (Guyana)
text:
The Justice Party was an <a href="Indo-Guyanese">Indo-Guyanese</a> political party in <a href="British%20Guiana">British Guiana</a>.
History.
The party was set up in 1964 with assistance from the <a href="Central%20Intelligence%20Agency">CIA</a>, and was led by Jai Narine Singh and <a href="Balram%20Singh%20Rai">Balram Singh Rai</a>. The American government hoped the new party, together with the <a href="Guiana%20United%20Muslim%20Party">Guiana United Muslim Party</a> (which the British government was funding), would take votes from the <a href="People%27s%20Progressive%20Party%20%28Guyana%29">People's Progressive Party</a> (PPP), whose left-wing leanings they were concerned about. Although the CIA estimated that the Justice Party and GUMP could win three seats in the <a href="1964%20British%20Guiana%20general%20election">1964 general elections</a>, neither did; the Justice Party received only 0.6% of the vote and failed to win a seat, whilst the PPP emerged as the largest party, but was unable to form a government.
The party did not contest any further elections.
